board_spray_adapter.name: Spraying Adapter Board
notes: It is the electronic board located on the back of the spray tank
Exposed to the spray mist when the spray tank outer shell is missing

motor_centrifugal_{NOZZLE}.name: Centrifugal Motor {SAME[NOZZLE]}
notes: Black, cylinder-shaped motor with a stainless steel axis protruding from the bottom. It is located at the end of the spray lance/boom, below Propulsion Motor {MOTOR_ABOVE_NOZZLE[NOZZLE]}.

motor_pump_{PUMP}.name: Impeller Pump Motor {SAME[PUMP]}
notes: Black, cylinder-shaped motor with a black and round magnet fixed to its axis. It is located on the bottom back of the spray tank.

sensor_flow_meter.name: Flow Meter
notes: Located on the back of the Spray tank, below the Spray Adapter Board and above the pumps. It is a black, box-shaped sensor with two hoses entering from the bottom and two hoses exiting from the top.
It is an electro-magnetic flow meter with no moving parts.
Exposed to the spray mist when the spray tank outer shell is missing

sensor_liquid_level.name: Liquid Level Meter
notes: Located on the bottom of the spray tank. It is a black, round and small sensor. It includes the cable to connect it to the Spray Adaptive Board.
Suffers from terrible design and/or manufacturing. Fails often.

sensor_load.name: Load Sensor
notes: Composed of 3 individual scales joined by a cable that connects to the Cable Distribution Board. The 3 scales support the entire weight of the spray tank and measure liquid approximately by assuming 1 liter weights 1 kilogram.
One scale is located on the center front of the tank, and the two other scales are located on the back with one on each side.

This sensor's readings are noisy and affected by inertial forces. It outputs slightly higher weight readings when the drone is accelerating in the +Z direction or decelerating in the -Z direction, and vice-versa. During landing, noise in the sensor usually triggers the 'Payload capacity exceeded' warning message, even when the spray tank is empty.
